DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale 34 Past Week Other Symptom 2 Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of whether or not they were experiencing the second of other symptoms, within the past week, using a yes or no response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week Other Symptom 2
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms._The most recent week, including today._A question about an individual's distress from the second of their other symptoms.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about an individual's distress from the second of their other symptoms.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: MSAS:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale. Portenoy, RK, et.al. Eur J Cancer. 1994;30A(9):1326-36.
